intro: Hypolytrum macrocephalum, commonly known as the large-headed marsh grass, is a species of flowering plant in the family Poaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is typically found in wetland habitats such as marshes and swampy areas. The plant features tall, slender stems and produces dense clusters of small, pale green to yellowish flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, with a fibrous texture that aids in its survival in waterlogged soils. Hypolytrum macrocephalum plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and provides habitat for various insect species.
